metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2177 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A null pointer dereference issue was found in the sctp network protocol in net/sctp/stream_sched.c in Linux Kernel. If stream_in allocation is failed, stream_out is freed which would further be accessed. A local user could use this flaw to crash the system or potentially cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1086-aws - 5.4.0-1086.93~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1094-azure - 5.4.0-1094.100~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1092-gcp - 5.4.0-1092.101~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1
